It's like my brain is a messy archive. The memories are there, but I couldn't locate it until later.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body: well it looks like i'm not the only one who's mind sometimes just goes blank and completely forgets what they are doing.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@ThatRandomGuy42":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53360b656368720330880000#post_53360b656368720330880000
It's so weird when you think about it though; for all you know you could have forgotten to zip your pants, forgot to take clothing stickers off, forgot to flush the toilet, forgot to check the mail, forgot to take your medicine, forgot to turn off the stove, forgot to take out the trash, forgot your wallet or announced to your crush that you like them and you wouldn't even remember.

Hell you could have gone streaking through walmart yelling, "*FREEDDOOOOMMMM!!*" while wearing blue face paint and playing the bagpipes and you would never know that you did it.

forgot to take clothing stickers off-done that
forgot to check the mail-done that
forgot to turn off the stove, forgot to take out the trash, forgot your wallet-done all those

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53360d676368720af8990000#post_53360d676368720af8990000

today i was buying a keyboard in the mall, when i was exiting the beep of the alarm set off on me, i checked every goddamn pocked i had but coulnt find anything, the guards let me go.

what if i stole something but forgot wshere i put it?

i also forget to take my eey medicine lots of times.
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53360e6263687234df990000#post_53360e6263687234df990000
I forgot to check the bottom of my shopping cart once and walked out of the store with a carton of milk I didn't pay for. Now the self checkout says "be sure sure to check the bottom of your cart"

Speaking of shopping, when someone asks to to get them a few things from the store I forget at least one thing, even if I only have to remember 3 things.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533622f363687273af9f0000#post_533622f363687273af9f0000
[bq="HJSDGCE"]Ever had that moment where you had an amazing idea, someone interrupted you and you forgot it entirely?
Kinda often to me.[/bq]
Speaking of which:
If you have a generator where the coils are on the outside instead of the inside and the armature is suspended at the tips through magnets and it's in a vacuum then you start it where does the energy come from?  Obviously energy is lost because it's not a absolute vacuum though, but that doesn't completely account for a lot.
